title: RiverDogs get former Braves, Yankees outfielder Andruw Jones as Hot Stove speaker
title_page: RiverDogs get former Braves, Yankees outfielder Andruw Jones as Hot Stove speaker
maintext:
Andruw Jones was leading the South Atlantic League in home runs at 17. He hit two home runs in a World Series game for the Atlanta Braves at 19. Jones, 40, also played for the New York Yankees alongside Derek Jeter and Alex Rodriguez while completing his Major League career with 434 home runs.
Those are some of the reasons the Charleston RiverDogs feel Jones is a good speaker pick for their 14th annual Hot Stove Banquet and Auction, scheduled for Feb. 2 at the Charleston Marriottâ€™s Crystal Ballroom.
Jones, a native of Curacao who currently works for the Braves as a special assistant in the Baseball Operations department, hit .254 and played in 76 postseason games. He had 10 consecutive 20-homer seasons. But Jones is best remembered for his defense in centerfield: 10 Gold Gloves and range-factor statistics that helped make Braves Hall of Fame pitchers Greg Maddux, John Smoltz and Tom Glavine so successful.
He also stole 152 bases.
Jones will join a list of Hot Stove speakers that have included Smoltz, Glavine, Ryne Sandberg, Bobby Cox, Goose Gossage and Jim Bouton.
Individual tickets to the Hot Stove Banquet are $75 and can be purchased online at riverdogs.com and rileyparkevents.com.
Groups can reserve a table of eight for $600 and a table for ten at $750 by contacting the RiverDogs Special Event Department at 843 577-DOGS.
